info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 7:09AM EDT until July 15 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Runoff from yesterdays heavy rains has caused the Bronx River to rise to moderate flood stage of around 3.7 ft early this morning
* WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following county, Bronx.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Water over Bronx River Parkway due to elevated stream flow on the Bronx River.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 AM EDT, The river is expected to crest this morning, and then slowly subside below minor flood stage of 3 ft through this afternoon. Flooding should subsides on the Bronx River Parkway once water levels fall below 3 ft. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East Tremont, Woodlawn and Fordham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
